titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Collection of Material about the Spanish Civil War LSC.0205
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Yasmin Damshenas with assistance from Megan Hahn Fraser in the Center for Primary Research and Training (CFPRT), August 2011; machine-readable finding aid created by Caroline Cubé.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-07-18 10:38:02 -0700.

did.unittitle: A collection of material about the Spanish Civil War
did.abstract: Collection includes pamphlets, magazines, newspapers, a book, mailers, a typed manuscript, and broadsides relating to the Spanish Civil War, primarily covering Pro-Communist and Democratic materials.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], A collection of material about the Spanish Civil War (Collection Number 205). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Note
processinfo.p: Processed by Yasmin Damshenas with assistance from Megan Hahn Fraser in the Center for Primary Research and Training (CFPRT), August 2011.

Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of pamphlets, magazines, newspapers, a book, mailers, a typed manuscript, and broadsides relating to the Spanish Civil War, published in the United States, England, France and Spain. Includes materials from the Spanish Refugee Aid, Inc., Pro-Fascist literature, and pro-Communist and Democratic literature. Includes work by Louis Fischer, Arnold Lunn, William Montevon, Earl Browder, Hubert C. Herring, Juan P. Fábregas and Fernando de los Rios.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Del Amo Foundation Spanish Civil War Collection (Collection 2012) . Available at the Department of Special Collections, Charles Young Research Library.

Pro-Communist, Democratic and non-Interventionist literature Pamphlets, typed drafts,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlet and copy of From the Spanish Trenches, a collection of letters from Loyalists in Spain, edited by Marcel Acier
